intro: Lysimachia racemiflora, commonly known as the clustered yellow loosestrife, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It is a member of the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, aiding in its propagation.
